intro: Hedysarum turcicum, commonly known as Turkish vetch, is a perennial legume native to the Mediterranean region. It features compound leaves with three to seven elliptical leaflets and produces yellow to orange pea-like flowers. The plant has a fibrous root system and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas. Hedysarum turcicum is valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability and use in ecological restoration projects.
